mdRecord.dcterms:description: Some diary entries with date, time, and weather, one with a confession of contemplating suicide. Attributed, the opening line of Gerard Manley Hopkins' poem, "God's Grandeur" [work]
Student graffiti art and messages inscribed on carrel walls in the new stacks, Alderman Library, University of Virginia, prior to the renovation of the building, 2020-2023. [host]
Time: 10:15 PM | Dec 7th, 2017 | 41Â° & dark | last night I was going to kill myself, but today I'm still alive | The world is charged with the Grandeur of God. | -G. Hopkins, S.J.
